conclusion: To determine the pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K, we can use the information provided in the p-T graph.
The p-T graph shows a linear relationship between pressure (p) and temperature (T).
From the graph, we can see two points: At T = 200 K, p = 0.5 × 10⁵ Pa and At T = 400 K, p = 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa.
The slope (m) of the line is calculated as m = Δp/ΔT = 0.25 × 10³ Pa/K.

premise: Slope m = 0.25 × 10³ Pa/K, Point (200 K, 0.5 × 10⁵ Pa)
conclusion: Using the point-slope form of a line p = mT + c, the y-intercept c is calculated as 0.
The equation of the line is p = 0.25 × 10³ × T.
Substitute T = 600 K into the equation: p = 0.25 × 10³ × 600 = 1.5 × 10⁵ Pa.
